DEA06260DFE60131B63468A86D17958E.description: Discuss the content of friendly notes, cards, letters, and personal narratives, with a partner or in a small group, to get to know the writer and each other

DE9FFF50DFE60131B63368A86D17958E.description: Respect the age, gender, and interests of the listener

DE9FA440DFE60131B63268A86D17958E.description: Share favorite anecdotes, riddles, and rhymes with peers and familiar adults

DE9F54F0DFE60131B63168A86D17958E.description: Participate in small or large group storytelling, singing, and finger play, in order to interact with classmates and adults in the classroom and school environment

DE9F0070DFE60131B63068A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for social interaction.

DE9AAFD0DFE60131B62368A86D17958E.description: Describe familiar persons, places, or objects

DE9A0530DFE60131B62168A86D17958E.description: Tell real or imaginative stories on the basis of response to illustrations

DE99B500DFE60131B62068A86D17958E.description: Describe the actions of characters in a story

DE995940DFE60131B61F68A86D17958E.description: Express the mood of a story by using a variety of words, with assistance

DE927070DFE60131B60B68A86D17958E.description: Take turns speaking in a group

DE9223D0DFE60131B60A68A86D17958E.description: Speak with speed and expression appropriate for the purpose

DE917CF0DFE60131B60868A86D17958E.description: Speak for different purposes (e.g., share ideas or information, retell a story, dramatize an experience or event)

DE912050DFE60131B60768A86D17958E.description: Use kindergarten-level vocabulary and grammar in own speech

DE903020DFE60131B60468A86D17958E.description: Speak with expression appropriate to the occasion

DE8F32B0DFE60131B60168A86D17958E.description: Speak in complete sentences when required

DE8EE350DFE60131B60068A86D17958E.description: Correct the pronunciation of words by using classroom resources, such as teachers, peers, audio- and videotapes, and computer software

DE8E9270DFE60131B5FF68A86D17958E.description: Take turns speaking in a group

DE8B3ED0DFE60131B5F568A86D17958E.description: Recognize differences in two or more versions of a familiar story, song, or finger play

DE8AF370DFE60131B5F468A86D17958E.description: Form an opinion about a book or play read aloud by using established criteria, such as title and vocabulary, to judge books

DE8AA670DFE60131B5F368A86D17958E.description: Form an opinion or evaluate information on the basis of information in the world

DE8A5760DFE60131B5F268A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for critical analysis and evaluation.

DE89F5E0DFE60131B5F168A86D17958E.description:
Listen to literary texts and performances to
  • appreciate and enjoy literary works
  • match spoken words with pictures, with assistance
  • recall a sequence of events from a personal experience or story
  • identify character and setting
  • respond to vivid language (e.g., nonsense words and rhymes)
  • identify specific people and places
  • distinguish between a story and a poem, with assistance

DE899D50DFE60131B5F068A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for literary response and expression.

DE8931F0DFE60131B5EF68A86D17958E.description: Identify similarities in information about people, places, and events

DE881280DFE60131B5EC68A86D17958E.description: Identify words and sentences on a chart, with assistance

DE877AF0DFE60131B5EA68A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for information and understanding.

DE863680DFE60131B5E668A86D17958E.description: Listen attentively for different purposes (e.g., to track individual words as they are spoken, to gain information)

DE85E9F0DFE60131B5E568A86D17958E.description: Listen attentively to spoken language (e.g., books read aloud, rhyming words, songs, video- and audio cassettes)

DE84C8B0DFE60131B5E268A86D17958E.description: Respond with expression appropriate to what is heard

DE83FC10DFE60131B5E068A86D17958E.description: Attend to a listening activity for a specified period of time

DE829980DFE60131B5DC68A86D17958E.description: Maintain a portfolio of writings and drawings for social interaction, with assistance

DE81F040DFE60131B5DA68A86D17958E.description: Respect the age, gender, and culture of the recipient, with assistance

DE819D80DFE60131B5D968A86D17958E.description: Share writings and drawings with peers or adults; for example, write/draw with a partner or in a cooperative group

DE8148D0DFE60131B5D868A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for social interaction.

DE80FCD0DFE60131B5D768A86D17958E.description: Maintain a portfolio of writings and drawings that express opinions and judgments, with assistance

DE80AD50DFE60131B5D668A86D17958E.description:
Draw and/or write to express opinions and judgments to
  • share what they know and have learned about a theme or topic
  • respond in pictures or words to an experience or event shared by a classmate
  • depict an opinion about statements, illustrations, characters, and events in written and visual texts
  • compare characters and settings within and between stories
  • describe the differences between real and imaginary experiences, with assistance

DE805E70DFE60131B5D568A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for critical analysis and evaluation.

DE800900DFE60131B5D468A86D17958E.description: Maintain a portfolio of writings and drawings in response to literature, with assistance

DE7FA840DFE60131B5D368A86D17958E.description:
Draw or write to respond to text to
  • express feelings about characters or events in a story
  • describe characters or events
  • list a sequence of events in a story, with assistance
  • retell a story

DE7F48B0DFE60131B5D268A86D17958E.description:
Draw or write original literary texts to
  • create a story with a beginning, middle, and end, using pictures/drawings and some words, with assistance
  • create poems or jingles, using pictures/drawings and some words, with assistance

DE7EEF40DFE60131B5D168A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for literary response and expression.

DE7EA350DFE60131B5D068A86D17958E.description: Use resources such as a picture dictionary or word wall to find and write words, with assistance

DE7E5490DFE60131B5CF68A86D17958E.description: Draw pictures to record facts from a lesson, with assistance

DE7E0180DFE60131B5CE68A86D17958E.description: Maintain a portfolio of informational writings and drawings, with assistance

DE7DB460DFE60131B5CD68A86D17958E.description: Use graphics such as posters to communicate information from personal experiences

DE7D64B0DFE60131B5CC68A86D17958E.description: Draw or write facts and ideas gathered from personal experiences

DE7D0AC0DFE60131B5CB68A86D17958E.description: Write own name on pictures, drawings, paintings, and written products

DE7CA500DFE60131B5CA68A86D17958E.description: Copy letters and words from books, magazines, signs, charts, and own dictation

DE7C4AC0DFE60131B5C968A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for information and understanding.

DE7B6660DFE60131B5C668A86D17958E.description: Write voluntarily to communicate for different purposes

DE7AB010DFE60131B5C468A86D17958E.description: Write compositions that include letters or words and drawings to communicate for different purposes (e.g., tell stories, communicate feelings, provide information)

DE7A55E0DFE60131B5C368A86D17958E.description: Write as part of play (e.g., playing school, store, restaurant)

DE79FDC0DFE60131B5C268A86D17958E.description: Label drawings with letters or words

DE795F00DFE60131B5C068A86D17958E.description: Write legibly some uppercase and lowercase letters

DE78B420DFE60131B5BE68A86D17958E.description: Write correctly own first and last names and the names of some friends or family

DE7865D0DFE60131B5BD68A86D17958E.description: Use conventional spelling to spell some common or familiar words

DE760750DFE60131B5B668A86D17958E.description: Use computer software to support development of early writing skills

DE75BA70DFE60131B5B568A86D17958E.description: Give and seek constructive feedback in order to improve writing

DE7567B0DFE60131B5B468A86D17958E.description: Use classroom resources, such as word walls, picture dictionaries, teachers, and peers, to support the writing process

DE750E60DFE60131B5B368A86D17958E.description: Use beginning-of-sentence capitalization and end punctuation

DE74B670DFE60131B5B268A86D17958E.description: Begin to edit your writings, with assistance

DE746550DFE60131B5B168A86D17958E.description:
Put words together in sentence format by using
  • end punctuation, such as periods
  • various parts of speech, such as nouns and adjectives, and verbs

DE741430DFE60131B5B068A86D17958E.description: Use the singular and plural of high-frequency words

DE736100DFE60131B5AE68A86D17958E.description: Write the letters of own first and last names

DE730850DFE60131B5AD68A86D17958E.description: Capitalize the first words of sentences, the letter "I," and proper nouns, such as names, days of the week, and months

DE72AEA0DFE60131B5AC68A86D17958E.description: Write recognizable upper- and lowercase letters in manuscript

DE7240D0DFE60131B5AB68A86D17958E.description: Use spacing between letters and words when writing on a line

DE71E9B0DFE60131B5AA68A86D17958E.description: Follow left-to-right and top-to-bottom direction when writing

DE718A10DFE60131B5A968A86D17958E.description: Create a drawing, picture, sign, or other graphic to represent a word or concept

DE708D80DFE60131B5A668A86D17958E.description: Recognize the vocabulary and writing conventions (e.g., greetings and closings) of social communication, with assistance

DE702B10DFE60131B5A568A86D17958E.description: Respect the age, gender, and cultural traditions of the writer, with assistance

DE6FD6B0DFE60131B5A468A86D17958E.description: Share reading experience to establish, maintain, and enhance personal relationships

DE6F8B00DFE60131B5A368A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for social interaction.

DE6F3CA0DFE60131B5A268A86D17958E.description:
Engage in pre-reading and reading activities to
  • identify what they know and have learned about a specific story or topic
  • use illustrations to assist in understanding the content of a text and to anticipate what will happen next
  • predict what could happen next or the outcome of a story or article read aloud
  • change the sequence of events in a story to create a different ending, with assistance
  • form an opinion about the differences between events in a story and events in own life
  • evaluate and select books, poems, or tapes on the basis of personal choice or teacher-selected criteria, such as topic, author, and illustrations
  • distinguish between real and imaginary stories

DE6EEE30DFE60131B5A168A86D17958E.description: Identify and explain ideas and experiences from texts and performances

DE6E9A10DFE60131B5A068A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for critical analysis and evaluation.

DE6E39A0DFE60131B59F68A86D17958E.description: Dramatize or retell stories, using puppets, toys, and other props

DE6DDCE0DFE60131B59E68A86D17958E.description:
Engage in pre-reading and reading activities to
  • select books, tapes, and poems on the basis of personal choice/interest or teacher-selected criteria, such as a theme/topic
  • make connections between personal experiences and stories read
  • predict what might happen next in a story read aloud
  • retell a story, with assistance

DE6D83E0DFE60131B59D68A86D17958E.description: Comprehend and respond to literary texts and performances

DE6D1200DFE60131B59C68A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for literary response and expression.

DE6CBC30DFE60131B59B68A86D17958E.description: Draw on a prior experience to understand new data, facts, and ideas

DE6C6740DFE60131B59A68A86D17958E.description: Interpret information represented in simple charts and webs

DE6C08B0DFE60131B59968A86D17958E.description: Read familiar informational texts to begin to collect data, facts, and ideas, with assistance

DE6BA750DFE60131B59868A86D17958E.description: Locate and use classroom and library media center resources to acquire information, with assistance

DE6B5B30DFE60131B59768A86D17958E.description: Students will read, write, listen, and speak for information and understanding.

DE6AB0E0DFE60131B59568A86D17958E.description: Show familiarity with some book titles and authors

DE6A1820DFE60131B59368A86D17958E.description: Show interest in reading a range of kindergartenlevel texts from a variety of genres, such as alphabet books, stories, poems, and informational texts

DE697EA0DFE60131B59168A86D17958E.description: Retell or dramatize stories or parts of stories

DE692DB0DFE60131B59068A86D17958E.description: Answer questions about text read aloud

DE687280DFE60131B58E68A86D17958E.description: Notice when sentences do not make sense

DE67CD60DFE60131B58C68A86D17958E.description: Use a picture dictionary to learn the meanings of words in books

DE677D60DFE60131B58B68A86D17958E.description: Connect vocabulary and life experiences to ideas in books

DE6726B0DFE60131B58A68A86D17958E.description: Use new vocabulary words to talk about life experiences

DE6685F0DFE60131B58868A86D17958E.description: Learn the meaning of new words and use them in own speech

DE65DDC0DFE60131B58668A86D17958E.description: Read familiar kindergarten-level texts at the emergent level

DE657290DFE60131B58568A86D17958E.description: Read automatically a small set of high-frequency sight words (e.g., a, the, I, my, use, is, are)

DE652590DFE60131B58468A86D17958E.description: Recognize and identify some sight words

DE64D320DFE60131B58368A86D17958E.description: Read own name and names of family or friends

DE63D750DFE60131B58068A86D17958E.description: Recognize that the sequence of letters in written words represents the sequence of sounds in spoken words

DE636F80DFE60131B57F68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that individual letters have associated sounds

DE631000DFE60131B57E68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and name automatically all uppercase and lowercase manuscript letters

DE626AF0DFE60131B57C68A86D17958E.description: Identify the parts of a book and their functions (e.g., front cover, back cover, and title page)

DE6211E0DFE60131B57B68A86D17958E.description: Track print by pointing to written words when texts are read aloud by self or others

DE612960DFE60131B57868A86D17958E.description: Follow left-to-right and top-to-bottom direction when reading English

DE60D410DFE60131B57768A86D17958E.description: Understand the purpose of print is to communicate

DE602650DFE60131B57568A86D17958E.description: Substitute one phoneme for another to make a new word ("The word is rug. Change /g/ to /n/. What is the new word?")—Phoneme Substitution

DE5FD630DFE60131B57468A86D17958E.description: Make a new word by adding a phoneme to an existing word ("What word do you have if you add /s/ to mile?"—Phoneme Addition

DE5F85E0DFE60131B57368A86D17958E.description: Recognize the remaining word when a phoneme is removed ("What is cat without the /k/?")—Phoneme Deletion

DE5F3390DFE60131B57268A86D17958E.description: Segment spoken words into component sounds using manipulatives (e.g., counters) to represent each sound ("How many sounds are there in big? Move three counters.")—Phoneme Segmentation

DE5EDD20DFE60131B57168A86D17958E.description: Blend spoken phonemes to form words using manipulatives (e.g., counters) to represent each sound: /b/ /i/ /g/—Phoneme Blending

DE5E8730DFE60131B57068A86D17958E.description: Categorize the word in a set of three or four words that has a different sound ("Which word doesn't belong: doll, dish, pill?")—Phoneme Categorization

DE5E15F0DFE60131B56F68A86D17958E.description: Identify the same sounds in different spoken words ("What sound is the same in sit, sip, and sun?")—Phoneme Identity

DE5D9EB0DFE60131B56E68A86D17958E.description: Isolate individual sounds within spoken words ("What is the first sound in can?")—Phoneme Isolation

DE5D51D0DFE60131B56D68A86D17958E.description: Count or tap the number of syllables in spoken words

DE5D0420DFE60131B56C68A86D17958E.description: Blend beginning sound (onset) with ending sound (rime) to form known words in rhyming word families (k-it, s-it, b-it)

DE5C05B0DFE60131B56968A86D17958E.description: Use computer software to support early reading development

DE5BA920DFE60131B56868A86D17958E.description: Read aloud with expression and fluency

DE5B4330DFE60131B56768A86D17958E.description: Monitor own reading by applying strategies (e.g., sounding out letters; using context, grammar, and picture clues; and rereading) to determine meaning

DE5A6B40DFE60131B56568A86D17958E.description: Recognize that words consist of a combination of sounds

DE59CFC0DFE60131B56368A86D17958E.description: Recognize own name and the names of friends and family in print

DE598450DFE60131B56268A86D17958E.description: Recognize the singular and plural of frequently used words

DE593450DFE60131B56168A86D17958E.description: Point to words in a text or on a chart when read aloud, matching spoken word to print

DE58DA10DFE60131B56068A86D17958E.description: Recognize the different sounds that make up a word

DE588D00DFE60131B55F68A86D17958E.description: Use beginning and ending consonants, as well as vowel sounds, to identify words

DE583C80DFE60131B55E68A86D17958E.description: Distinguish the difference between vowels and consonants

DE57F2E0DFE60131B55D68A86D17958E.description: Alphabetize high-frequency words according to the first letter

DE57A970DFE60131B55C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and identify letters of the alphabet

DE570550DFE60131B55A68A86D17958E.description: Follow left-to-right and top to bottom direction when reading

DE56B7B0DFE60131B55968A86D17958E.description: Recognize the difference between letters and words
